abstract.title: Objectives:
abstract.p: To evaluate the prevalence of cardiac injury and its association with mortality in hospitalized patients infected with avian influenza A (H7N9) virus.

sec.title: Setting:
sec.p: A total of 133 hospitals in 17 provinces, autonomous regions, and municipalities of mainland China that admitted influenza A (H7N9) virus–infected patients between January 22, 2015, and June 16, 2017.

sec.title: Patients:
sec.p: A total of 321 patients with influenza A (H7N9) virus infection were included in the final analysis.

sec.title: Measurements and Main Results:
Conclusions:
sec.p: Cardiac injury is a frequent condition among hospitalized patients infected with influenza A (H7N9) virus, and it is associated with higher risk of mortality.
